event_data.continuation_prompt:
Mission: StageOrchestrator API Compatibility - Final Verification & Documentation
=========================================================

CONTEXT:
Cycle 1 completed successfully with all 66 tests passing. The StageOrchestrator has 100% backward API compatibility with the legacy RDMissionController.

PREVIOUS CYCLE RESULTS:
- 16/16 API compatibility tests PASS
- 10/10 conductor integration patterns PASS
- 6/6 stage transitions PASS
- 14/14 adversarial edge cases PASS
- 19/19 spec alignment items verified

OBJECTIVE FOR CYCLE 2:
1. Run a LIVE integration test using atlasforge_conductor.py (not mocked)
2. Verify USE_MODULAR_ENGINE=true is properly set in af_engine/__init__.py
3. Test actual stage transitions through the conductor workflow
4. Create final documentation summarizing the API surface
5. Mark mission COMPLETE if all live tests pass

VALIDATION STEPS:
1. Clear Python cache to ensure fresh imports
2. Verify feature flag: python3 -c "import af_engine; print(af_engine.USE_MODULAR_ENGINE)"
3. Run live integration: Import atlasforge_conductor and verify it uses StageOrchestrator
4. Execute a minimal stage transition cycle
5. Document any edge cases or warnings observed

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- atlasforge_conductor.py imports and runs without AttributeError
- Live stage transitions work (PLANNING -> BUILDING -> TESTING)
- Mission state persists correctly across operations
- No regressions from previous test results

FILES TO VERIFY:
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/af_engine/__init__.py (feature flag)
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/af_engine/orchestrator.py (API implementation)
- /home/vader/AI-AtlasForge/atlasforge_conductor.py (consumer)

DELIVERABLES:
- Live test results showing successful conductor integration
- Final mission report confirming COMPLETE status
- Optional: API reference documentation

cycle_report.summary: Completed comprehensive API compatibility audit and validation for StageOrchestrator. All 66 tests pass confirming 100% backward API compatibility with legacy RDMissionController. The modular af_engine is fully functional and ready for production use with atlasforge_conductor.py.
achievements: Completed full API audit of legacy RDMissionController (af_engine_legacy.py)
Documented all 16+ public methods, properties, and attributes used by atlasforge_conductor.py

Verified all API compatibility: mission getter/setter, mission_dir, load_mission(), save_mission(), update_stage(), build_rd_prompt(), process_response(), set_mission(), reset_mission(), log_history(), get_recent_history(), increment_iteration(), load_mission_from_file(), _queue_processing flag
Created comprehensive test suite with 66 tests covering API compatibility, conductor integration, stage transitions, and adversarial edge cases
All 66 tests pass with 100% success rate
Epistemic score: 1.0 (Rigorous) - no property violations or adversarial issues found
RDMissionController alias correctly points to StageOrchestrator for drop-in compatibility
issues: None - all known gaps were already fixed in previous implementation work
